intro: Memora campicola, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or white, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to minimize water loss. Memora campicola is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
